1. Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Giumarra Brothers has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 Giumarra Brothers, Risk and Process Safety Management Program



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Giumarra Brothers has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name             |        Process Chemical    |      Process Quantity(lbs.)

Ammonia Refrigeration            Anhydrous Ammonia                  58,200



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.



Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 

1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RM

P obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.



1.2 Process Description



Giumarra Brothers operates a commercial cold storage facility for tree fruit in Reedley, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:

- (3) Precoolers

- (7) Cold Storage Rooms

- (1) Staging Area



The refrigerated spaces are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation. All control valve groups are mounted on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within a refrigeration machinery room or directly outside near the machinery room. A partial list of system components includes:

- (1) Vilter VSR-151 Compressor

- (1) Vilter VSS-301 Compressor

- (1) Vilter VSS-1051 Compressor

- (1) Vilter VSS-1201 Compressor

- (1) 24" Dia. x 6'-0" Long Thermosyphon Vessel

- (2) B.A.C. Model C2604-K Condensers

- (1) B.A.C. Model C2643-L Condenser

- (1) 60" Dia. x 14'-0" Long Main Suction Accumulator

- (1) 16" Dia. x 4'-0" Long Transfer Vessel

- (1) 96" Dia. x 32'-0" Long High Pressure Receivers

- (1) Shell and Tube Glycol Chiller

- (1) Emergency Control Box

- (1) McCormack Model 73CC64AFEO-S Air Units for the Electrical Room

- (32) Spiral Fin Aluminum Bunker Coils designed for the facility's (7) storage rooms - 10 Rows Wide x 8 Rows High x 240" Finned Length

- (32) Spiral Fin Aluminum Bunker Coils designed for the (3) precoolers - 10 Rows Wide x 8 Rows High x 240" Finned Length



The system operates as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped to the each cold room, where it passes through an expansion valve int

o low temperature and pressure accumulator vessel mounted on the roof. From the accumulators, cold liquid ammonia is circulated through evaporator coils. As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia vaporizes to form low temperature and pressure gas which is returned to the accumulator vessels. The ammonia vapor is returned from the accumulator vessels through a suction return line to the main suction accumulator inside the machinery room.  From the main suction accumulator, ammonia is piped to the suction inlet on the compressors. The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to water cooled evaporative condensers where the high pressure gas ammonia is cooled, liquefied and returned to the thermosyphon vessel and then to the high pressure receiver.



Giumarra Brothers was built in 1995 by California Controlled Atmosphere.  The system was built in accordance with the codes and standards in place at the time of construction.  The system contains numerous safety devices including sensors which stop the compressors if temperatures or pressures exceed or drop below established limits, and pressure relief valves which vent ammonia gas to the atmosphere if the pressure in the system exceeds their set point.  Each entrance to the machinery room contains emergency refrigeration and ventilation controls for use during an emergency situation.



The ammonia system at Giumarra Brothers consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping.  As such, the refrigeration system at Giumarra Brothers is treated as a single process.



1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



1.3.1 General

 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Giumarra Brothers has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of wor

st-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 



1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia



The ammonia refrigeration process at the Giumarra Brothers facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 58,200 lbs. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.



Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 



1.4 Five Year Accident History



Giumarra Brothers has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan



Giumarra Brothers' emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

- California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

- Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38 



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Giumarra Brothers has implemented many policies and procedure

s to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Giumarra Brothers continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Giumarra Brothers' ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Giumarra Brothers' management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Giumarra Brothers has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Giumarra Brothers has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.



For the future, Giumarra Brothers now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Giumarra Brothers employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Giumarra Brothers will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
